title: On RG potential in Yang-Mills theories
abstract: We construct an RG potential for N=2 supersymmetric SU(2) Yang-Mills theory, and extract a positive definite metric by comparing its gradient with the recently discovered beta-function for this system, thus proving that the RG flow is gradient in this four-dimensional field theory. We also discuss how this flow might change after supersymmetry breaking, provided the quantum symmetry group does not, emphasizing the non-trivial problem of asymptotic matching of automorphic functions to perturbation theory.
